page.title: 06ROSE GROWING
page.content: Suttons Roses in the village of West Walton is an inportant local industry. Mr Sutton grows three main types of roses ,Tubercular roses, Bush roses and Climbing roses. The dark soil in this area is very good for growing most roses. Although he does use fertiliser to make his plants grow better and produce a better crop. This summer in 1985 he is growing over one million roses.He actually owns about thirty three acres of land and he rents another three hundred acres. There are many problems how ever. Rose plants suffer from a disease called mildew. This is when the plant is exposed to the damp and fungi grows on it. The fungi can also cause a disease called rust which produces spots on the leaves.
